creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Margaret McMillan Webber in memory of her mother, Katherine Kittredge McMillan
description:
Moses overpowering Pharaoh with the aid of a dragon 

43.31.1 and 51.37.16,.19,.24,.25 are all from the same manuscript, the "Majma' al-tavarikh."
marks: Text is Persian; black ink is in naskhi script, re
medium: Ink, opaque watercolor, and gold on paper
text: Moses, who is clad in blue and a white turban on the right, overpowers the Egyptian Pharaoh with the aid of a dragon, representing a theme that is partially drawn from the Old Testament. The inclusion of the dragon reflects a Chinese influence, which in turn expressed the Mongol's patronage of Chinese imperial academies of history and painting.  Timur deeply valued his Mongol lineage, and used their victories as inspiration for his own conquests.
title: Moses Prevailing over Pharaoh
